SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractManager<T>
The AbstractManager defines an AbstractClass that can Manage any generic type.
AdminConsole
The AdminConsole sets up the main screen Users will be greeted to We are able to add Users and Groups to the Tree View, execute Analysis methods, and enter the User View for selected Users.
Analyzer
The Analyzer implements the AnalyzerInterface and implements methods for calculating the program's statistics
AnalyzerInterface
The AnalyzerInterface serves as the Visitor for our program and keeps track of analytical statistics of the Twitter console We keep track of the user count, the group count, the message count, and the message sentiment
Driver
The Driver demos the functionality of the code by simply retrieving the AdminConsole instance
FollowerInterface
The FollowerInterface defines an object that can follow Posters and be updated when they post a message.
IDValidator
The IDValidator Singleton class provides a hub of validation for User IDs In short, User IDs are unique (throughout both Groups and Users), and other validations could be done here as well (length, illegal characters, etc) Since this is a Singleton, we only define one instance that is shared amongst any classes that need IDs in the program
PosterInterface
The PosterInterface defines an object that can make posts.
RootGroup
The RootGroup class (extends UserGroup) is a Singleton that maintains existence of only one Root Group.
TwitterFrame
The TwitterFrame class extends the JFrame class and implements helper methods and constant attributes for any JFrame created for the Mini-Twitter application (admin or userview)
User
The User class implements interfaces for the UserInterface composite component, a PosterInterface to serve as an Subject, and a FollowerInterface to serve as an Observer.
UserFactory
A simple Factory class to create Users and UserGroups.
UserGroup
The UserGroup class implements the UserInterface Composite Component to allow UserGroups to hold other UserGroups and other Users.
UserGroupManager
The UserGroupManager keeps track of all the UserGroups created Since this is a Singleton and extends the AbstractManager class, we define methods for getting the instance and comparing items
UserInterface
The UserInterface is used to implement both Users and User Groups, acting as a composite's Component.
UserManager
The UserManager keeps track of all the Users created Since this is a Singleton and extends the AbstractManager class, we define methods for getting the instance and comparing items
UserView
The UserView sets up buttons for following other users and displaying followers and Users followed by this user.
UserViewManager
The UserViewManager keeps track of all the UserViews created Since this is a Singleton and extends the AbstractManager class, we define methods for getting the instance and comparing items
